column1: length around off stump, pushed to short mid-off
gets the edge, but there's no slip. Slanting away from the left-hander, who pushed at it inside the line.

outside edge clears short third man! Two boundaries off two balls, both of edges. Down the track to lift him over cover, but gets a thick edge that goes to short third man's left. Outstretched hand by the fielder but the ball eludes him
quicker one, length outside off, left alone
darts it in on a length on off, jabbed into the offside
flat and shortens the length as he spots him coming down, cramped for room and can only bunt it back towards the bowler
full outside off, leans into the cover drive but can't beat the man at short cover
tailing into him, very full again, nudged to mid-on's right.
swinging into him again, but too full, and clipped off his toes. Doesn't get the timing right, but gets a couple through midwicket

shot! Amir is keeping it full and coming into the left-hander from over the wicket, and he uses his wrists to pick this up from the stumps and flick it over deep square leg for the first six of the match
was going across to set himself up for another pick-up shot over square leg but gets an inside edge onto pad that rolls into the legside
fullish on off, pushed to the bowler's left, very straight. Softly enough that they can take a quick single
strays on the pads, and he uses his wrists again to flick through midwicket
slower ball, too early into the push and this is bowled in a good channel, just outside off. Beats the batsman. Straightens a touch and past the outside edge

diving catch by the keeper and Maqsood has struck. Good ball, on a hard length and nipping away. Lyth goes to drive without moving his feet, gets a healthy edge that is travelling to Walton's left, but he pulls off an acrobatic catch.

length ball outside off, stands up tall and punches through point, where the fielder dives and gets a hand to it. That slows the ball enough to be pulled inside the boundary. Good shot to get his innings going
slower ball, on a length outside off. He was foxed initially but then adjusted well to pull his bat inside the line and let the ball glide off fine to third man
good length outside off, driven firmly from the crease but can't beat cover
fullish on a fifth stump line, comes on the front foot to steer towards point

oh that's mighty unlucky. Masood has been run out at the non-striker's end because Ashraf belted a drive straight, which Amir has got a touch of a boot on. Masood had no time to react and get his back back in the crease. The ball was hit hard but Amir reacted quickly by sticking his left foot out. Couldn't stop the ball, but ended up getting a better result. Messi couldn't have done it better with the delicate deflection - though that is not what Amir intended.
length outside off, punched forcefully to mid-off
full, tailing in at the end, defended back down the pitch
slips in the bouncer after having bowled full throughout and the batsman ducks underneath
fuller and coming into him, worked backward of square with soft hands. No fielder there so they pinch two. The man who gathers the ball scores a direct hit, but the batsmen are well in
dropped at deep square leg. Tried to go big, didn't time it, into the legside and Parnell has plenty of time to gather this cleanly but spills it.
back of a length on off, tries to slap a pull shot, but gets it off the bottom half of the bat towards mid-on
makes good connection now, full on the stumps and lofts his drive to mid-on's left
fuller, slower one, tucked to short fine leg
length ball outside off, bunted to mid-off
fuller on the stumps, driven to mid-off
back of a length, goes back to pull but doesn't time it well. Rolls to deep square leg
fuller outside off, goes to drive but gets a toe-end to mid-off.

run out after a bad call. Rossouw has done himself in here. He's not been timing them at all, shaped as if to ramp that, the bowler wasn't fooled and bowled it full. He tickled it fine and set off for a run. There was none there and the non-striker didn't respond. Rossouw was halfway down the pitch when he turned around to try and make it back, but the bowler had enough time to run up to the stumps and break them as the keeper flicked him the ball.

nearly another run out. Fuller on off, driven to mid-off where Alex Hales fumbles .They set off for a run even though it was hit firmly and straight to the fielder. A clean collection would have had him in trouble
tapped to cover for a safer quick single
length on the stumps, goes back to whip this to long-on
length on the stumps, goes back and flicks through midwicket

caught at long-on and Multan are unravelling quickly here. He's been trying to hit them hard but not timing them. Skipped down the track to another flat ball, wanted to lift him straight but get sit off the end of the bat. The ball loops up and settles safely into the fielder's hands.
goes for the wicket now Imad, flat and quick on a length outside off, jabbed back
tosses this up a bit outside off, steered to short third man
fuller on off, driven gently to long-off
fuller on leg stump, tapped to mid-on's right
floated up outside off, made him reach for the drive and beats him. Got his back leg back inside crease though
flat on leg stump, patted to long-on
flatter, darted into him, turned to midwicket
length ball cramping him for room around off, tapped to midwicket
driven on the front foot this time to long-off
digs it in back of a length outside off, goes back and pushes to cover
fuller on off, clipped through midwicket
digs it in back of a length but he stays back and slaps it with a horizontal bat to long-on's left
length ball on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
fuller on the stumps, clipped off his toes to deep square
fuller outside off, fluent drive through cover, but there is protection in the deep there
full, drifting on the pads, flicked to midwicket's right
flatter on off, goes back and punches to long-on
creates room by clearing his front leg and biffing this to cover, who fumbles and they take a single
fuller on the stumps, worked through midwicket on the front foot
length ball, turning in from outside off, goes back and punches to long-on
darted into him as he was coming on the front foot and he squirts it back to the bowler
back of a length, goes back and pulls to deep square leg. Much needed boundary
fuller outside off, launches it over point with a freeflowing swing
length ball coming into him, jabbed back to the bowler's right. He can't collect cleanly and they take a single
short outside off, stands up and slaps it to deep point
slower ball on a length outside off, too early into the drive and is beaten outside off

peachy shot. This time he read the slower ball, and it was also pitched too full. Unleashes a cover drive, holds his shape beautifully. Ball clears infield and pings into the boundary. Much-needed over for Multan
comes down the track, the bowler shortens his length but he's slow enough for the batsman to adjust and punch to mid-off's right
flatter on off, jammed to long-on

down the track and bang she goes. Nails this lofted drive perfectly. Made as if to clear his leg, and got the ball in his arc as he skipped down, got to the pitch and extended his arms to lift this waaay over long-on
down the track again, but this is flatter, punched to cover
and once again he comes down but the bowler is keeping it flatter. This is punched towards mid-on
stays in his crease this time and cuts this to point's left
back of a length, goes back and pulls strongly but there is a deep midwicket in place
back of a length again, doesn't nail the pull this time, mis-timed through midwicket. Cramped for room that time with the ball coming into him

caught at deep square leg. Hits the hard length again, and he clears his front leg to get the space to free his arms. Doesn't nail his pull shot, and the ball doesn't have the legs to carry over the boundary. Sherfane Rutherford moves to his left and pouches it smartly.
fuller outside off, steered to point
length outside off, keeps a bit low and Bopara misses the cut
short ball outside off, swivels to pull to deep midwicket.
fuller on the stumps, driven to long-on
goes across and Amir has also gone across the batsman so Afridi ends up just nudging this to third man from close to his pads
back of a length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket
going across again, Amir follows, no room for the batsman and he just bunts it to cover
length ball outside off, punched to mid-off and he scrambles through for a quick single.
going across his stumps again, this time Amir bangs in a short ball that Afridi is late to pull, having got inside the line. Wears the blow on chest guard
back of a length, turned to midwicket from outside off
slogs across the line to this fuller one outside off, gets a toe-end to long-on
still going across his stumps. This one almost lands in the slot, but he can't connect cleanly with the hoick across the line. Gets a thick inside edge towards fine leg

length ball coming into him on off stump, dabbed into the offside. They take a quick single even as the fielder swoops in to hit the stumps direct. Afridi is in, but he can't take a second off the ricochet having over-run
and walks across again, predictably enough now. Banged in on a hard length, not enough room to free his arms. Short-arm pull mistimed through midwicket
back of a length outside off, steered to third man
back of a length on a fourth stump line, stays beside the ball and cuts to third man
slower bouncer and he's completely foxed by that. Moves across his stumps, as he's done all innings long. Drops his bat thinking it'll be a wide but the bouncer goes past him
and that is a quicker one in the channel, Afridi ends up beaten, feeling for it
fuller outside off, uses wrists to turn it to fine leg.
slower ball on off, turned around the corner. Multan getting only singles. No boundary for four overs now
full outside off, whipped to deep midwicket, but again to the fielder
digs it into the hard length outside off, Afridi walks across to pull and misses it completely.

finally connects one. He's been walking across his stumps all innings long, gets one back of a length that is in the right spot, pulls it over deep square leg. Still not perfectly timed but hit hard enough

caught at long-on. Moves across again, this time Arshad bowls it full. Afridi gets a lot of bottom hand onto this one, makes decent connection actually but can't get properly underneath it and it goes in a flattish arc to Hales, who takes it above his head, well inside the boundary.
fuller on off, driven to cover
quick bouncer, was late on it, but ends up making good connection by going through his shot quickly. To deep midwicket's right, for a couple
pulled hard, back of a length outside off and just sat up waist high. Good connection but there is a fielder there
keeps this one back of a length but wide outside off. Tanvir reaches for it and squirts it to a squarish third man
lovely. Makes some room and lofts this straight back over the bowler's head, all the way over the boundary. Beautiful execution by Bopara. This was a full and slower ball, and he hit it cleanly
he's picked out deep midwicket. Normal pace ball, back of a length outside off. Bopara swivels and pulls - times it really well in fact - but he's hit it straight to the fielder.
yorker on the stumps first up, defended back to the bowler
length ball coming into him, plays from close to his body to steer towards point
back of a length outside off, punched through point
length ball coming into him, punched to long-on

good short ball, climbing up on him at the stumps, he manages to get bat on it to squirt to third man. Tanvir calls him through for a single to get back on strike. A direct hit at the bowler's end would have been the end of Ilyas.
nails the pull. Short outside off, he goes back and is in control of the pull shot. Places is perfectly to find the deep midwicket boundary
another short one but slower, early into the pull, goes off the bottom half of the bat towards square leg
yorker outside off, but he's stepped away to give himself room, goes down on one knee and carves it to third man
yorker goes wrong, full toss outside off, but he can't get timing on his punch, goes straight to extra cover
yorker on off to start, can only toe-end it back down the pitch towards the bowler
wham. That's been powerfully hit. Was going for another yorker but ends up as a full toss that Tanvir smacks over deep square leg. That's gone on the roof. Excellent timing on that.
boom there goes another one. This time he comes on the front foot to a full ball and swings with extended arms to get it over long-on
cramps him for room this time as he's stepping away and he pushes it to the bowler's left. Takes the single so he's off strike
back of a length coming into him, he misses connecting with the pull but it flicks his thigh pad and goes fine for four leg byes

dropped at long-off and they get two off the last ball. Backs away to slog this but gets it off the toe-end while down on his knee. Babar at long-off has to run to his left. The ball's swirling high, but he can't quite get under it. Ends up having to lunge for it and can't hold on.
floated up on a length outside off, driven to mid-off
flatter and straigther, tapped to mid-on
tossed up outside off, slightly round-arm. driven back to the bowler
through the gap. Tossed up outside off again and Babar opens the bat face to thread the gap between cover and point
comes forward and pushes this length ball to mid-off with soft hands. Pops up a bit but hit softly so they scramble a quick single
carefully defends a full ball into the offside on the front foot
back of a length on leg stump line, turned off his hips to deep square
just clears extra cover. Gets a leading edge, trying to flick this away and the ball loops up. Barely clears the in-field
slapped to cover off the back foot. Length ball on off
length ball on the stumps, punched nicely but straight to point
length around off, comes on the front foot to punch to mid-off. Early call of 'NO' for a quick single
back of a length and Babar shows his class, goes fractionally back and pulls this through midwicket to find the boundary
length ball around off, goes back to pull it through square leg. Not timed well

and again. This is even better than the boundary last over. Back of a length again but you would think not short enough to pull through midwicket. Unless you're Babar Azam of course. He transfers weight back, gets on top of the bounce and pulls - all in one fluid motion
length outside off, glides it to third man
length outside off, steered to third man

oooh that was a strange shot. Length ball nibbling around off, he almost wanted to pull out of a shot then decided at the last moment to dab it to third man off the end of the bat while pulling away. They get two with good running, the ball's fine enough that the third man fielder has to run to his left a bit
pushed to mid-off, takes a couple of steps and decides against the single early

caught at deep square leg. Imran Tahir almost dropped it, popped out of his hands but he caught it with his right hand even as he was sliding down with the momentum. Back of a length, Sharjeel swivels and pulls it hard. Tahir has to run to his right to make ground and he gets there, then holds on eventually. Smile on his face with ball in his hand as he ends up in a relaxed sitting pose on the ground.
back of a length very straight, nicely done by Hales who moves across and glances it fine
very straight and Babar shows the full face of the bat to punch it back. Tanvir manages to stop it on his follow through
fuller and on the fifth stump, tries to clip it back straight but doesn't time it that well. Tanvir again gets some body on it and deflects it to extra cover

huge appeal not given and Tanvir wants a review. But they don't take one. The ball probably pitched outside leg. On a length, Babar was moving across to clip it fine, goes off his pads to square leg. Good decision to not take the review, that ball pitched outside leg
length on the stumps, stands tall to punch to extra cover
class. Too full on the stumps, and driven to the bowler's left. Nobody moved

dismissive. Length ball on leg stump and Babar just stays still and pulls to deep square leg. No fielder there. He's managed to play a pull shot with the minimal movement of a glance almost. I have no idea how he does it.
fuller outside off and he opens the bat face late to steer through point
back of a length outside off, firmly pushed to cover
punched and finds the gap through point Back of a length, stays on the back foot and beside the ball and times it beautifully
length ball, punched to cover
good length on the stumps, defended into the offside. They run a quick single. Ilyas hares down the pitch and picks up and scores a direct hit, but Hales has made his ground
back of a length on off, punched to point
biffed to long-on. Full ball and he uses bottom-hand power to punch this. Not very high but enough to just clear mid-on
Inside out he goes and finds the third man boundary. Makes some room and carves this by opening the bat face
back of a length on off, punched to cover
back of length again, punched straight to cover.
tossed up very full, ends up yorker length almost, driven back to the bowler
length outside off, comes on the front foot to punch through cover
stays back to this length ball and punches to deep cover
on off stump, stays beside it and chops it to short third man
skids on quicker, but a bit shorter which gives him the room to whip through midwicket
down the track but Tahir saw him and bowled flatter and shorter, pushed through midwicket
length on the stumps, pushed into the offside
darts into him, punched back to the bowler
denying him room again, Hales tries to step away but the ball follows. Back to the bowler off the inside half
makes room again but the bowler keeps trying to follow him, pushed to long-on
comes on the front foot to get to the pitch and clip to long-on
stays back and flicks this to deep midwicket
full outside off, width offered and Hales goes down on one knee to slap this through cover. Uses his reach and times this well
bowls straighter now and Hales drives towards mid-off
length ball outside off, cuts it well but backward point gets body behind it tumbling to his right to keep them to one
fuller on the pads, clipped through midwicket
down the track, full toss and he tries to smack it over deep square but gets the under-edge that rolls down
comes on the front foot to drive this fuller one to long-off

another run out at the non-striker's end. Happened to Masood in the first innings and now Hales is the unfortunate man. Babar came down the track and bashed this hard at the bowler, to his right. Was a dropped catch in fact since it came straight to him, but he spilled it in the direction of the stumps, and Hales was out of his crease.
length ball on leg stump, turned through midwicket
fuller on the stumps, driven with a straight bat to long-on
full outside off, pushed through cover on the front foot
length ball, stays back and punches it to long-on
down the track, he bowls it flat and shorter, tucked to deep midwicket off his pads
length ball, stays legside of it and cuts it to deep cover
stays back and punches this length ball to long-off
bang. Too short and he spotted that early, rocks back and smashes a pull over deep midwicket
strays down leg, Babar doesn't connect with the sleep. They take a single too. so two wides
beaten on the cut outside off
fuller on the stumps, driven to long-off
loud appeal but inside edge onto pad. Skids on from a length, he was coming forward to defend

back of a length outside off, he goes to pull it and he's broken his bat. That's snapped clean from near the handle almost. The part that broke missed hitting the stumps though. Ball goes through midwicket

loud and sustained appeal for an lbw but this might have been going down leg, and height also an issue. They've gone for a review. Babar had moved across actually so that is a lot straighter than I thought. Pitched on a length and nipped in, Babar missed it. and it's umpire's call on impact. Just clipping the top of the stumps. Close call for Babar. Multan retain the review
fuller on the stumps, uses his wrists to flick through midwicket
fuller outside off, and he unfurls a nicely timed cover drive. Tahir has to run to his right, slide, and stop the ball from going over the ropes. Good work by the 41-year-young man
nippy, back of a length and coming into him, he flashes at it but doesn't connect. Goes between bat and body to the keeper
too full swinging in and ends up on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
patted to long-off
length ball, stays back and chops it through cover. Good work at deep extra cover again as the man dives to his right to save the boundary
down the track, wanted to go over the offside but it rolls off the inside edge towards midwicket

dropped at long-on. Tough chance, diving forward. Down the track he went, couldn't quite get it cleanly, got it off the end of the bat. The ball was looping towards long-on and the fielder ran in and dived straight but could get only fingertips to it. Would have been a spectacular catch

skier caught at cover. Strange shot-selection from Iftikhar, who has looked to be ultra aggressive this over. Down the track again, wants to go straight and over, but gets a toe-end that swirls up high. Well judged catch
comes down the track and punches but straight to cover
length outside off, steered to third man
fuller on the pads, turned to deep midwicket
premeditated a reverse sweep, and plays it to a full toss. Goes to short third man but they scamper a single
gets to fifty with a calm drive to long-off. He's the key to this chase
down the track, biffs this to long-off, where the fielder has to move a bit to his left to field. Fumbles but manages to keep them to just one
flatter on the pads, flicked to long-on
b-e-a-u-tiful. Steps down the track and lofts this cleanly, the timing's so good that it's sailed way over long-on. Got to the pitch and swung his bat in a clean, pleasing arc
patted to long-on
length ball on the stumps, cuts from close to his body to deep point.
length outside off, punched to long-off on the front foot
good length, comes on the front foot and pushes to cover
bowls this wider outside off and Babar slaps it to deep extra cover
length ball on off, punched through cover. Direct hit ricochet gives them an extra run. Hit at the striker's end and narrowly rolled passed the keeper's helmet. Would have been five runs
fuller on the stumps, patted towards mid-on. The bowler can't get there while diving to his right so they take a single
down legside and he'll have to rebowl that. Imad wanted to get some bat on it but can't connect with the pull
fuller on the stumps, flicked off his toes to deep square leg

edge but perhaps didn't carry to the keeper. Landed just short of him. Good ball on off, nipping away, Babar dropped his hands in time when he realised the ball was not there to drive on the up, and got the edge. But because he had dropped his hands the ball didn't carry. Third man fields
fuller on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, punched from the crease to mid-off's left.
back of a length well outside off, comes down the track and slaps it to deep cover
good length on a tight line on off, punched to cover

caught behind. There might be a twist yet. Babar was giving himself room to thrash this through the offside, but Tanvir had bowled this much straighter, and he gets bounce too. Ended up too close to Babar and bouncing a tad more than he expected, and he edges it through to the keeper
length ball on leg stump, comes nicely inside the line and clips it off his pads through square leg

caught at long-on. Full ball on the stumps, he made some room to loft this straight. Doesn't get it quite of the middle and he can only pick out long-on. Not perhaps the best choice of shot when you need about a run a ball
length outside off, punched to point
fuller outside off, biffed to long off
fuller outside off, nicely forward to push this to cover's right
flat and full on a sixth stump line, Imad drives to long-off again

he's got him!. The change of angle, the mind games, they work. Tossed up wide outside off, tempting Rutherford into going for the big drive. He gets a thin, but audible, snick and the keeper does well to latch on.
stump to stump, length ball, punched to mid-off
length on off, flat batted to long-off

direct hit from point and Parnell is run out. That was strange running from Parnell, he was just jogging. Good length ball outside off, nicely cut but straight to point. Imad has called him through for the single - right call I think since he needs to be on strike. Parnell just jogs across. The fielder takes aim and shatters the stumps with Parnell yards short.
stunning. Pressure building and Imad just goes back deep and uses wrists and bottom hand to flick this from outside off to over deep midwicket
fuller, punched to extra cover
back of a length outside off, he makes room to try and swing at it but misses
backs away and punches this over the bowler's head down the ground. Not great connection as it bounces to long-off
length ball outside off, and he threads the gap between point and short third man with a finely timed boundary
superb start by the bowler. A bouncer that is on target, has Amir ducking into it and holding up his bat to fend at it. Takes the helmet I think on the way to the keeper

straight down deep midwicket's throat! but it has brought Imad back on strike. Amir went for the glory shot, short ball dug into the pitch, not enough pace on it, Amir goes back to pull. Doesn't get a good enough hit and picks out the fielder. But the batsmen have crossed
full outside off, he was moving across and uses wrists again to try to seep it through midwicket. He's looking for two but will have to settle for one
full outside off and he nails the shot, carves it over extra cover for a single
dot ball as Imad lets it go! He went for the wide outside off one and I think he's lucky to get away with it. The ball was cutting across the tram line as it passed the batsman!

finishes with a four to get a Super Over. Imad moves waaay across to be on a seventh stump line and Ilyas bowls it there. He plays a wonderful pick up off his legs backward square leg and finds the boundary to tie the scores.
